availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Shelby County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Louisianna Gill. Father of Rubin Gill, James Gill, Thomas Gill, Catharine Gill, Sarah Gill, and William Gill. Farmer in Shelby County in 1850. Owned ten enslaved persons in Shelby County in 1850.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, p. 368.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District 2.
Federal Mortality Census Schedules, 1850-1880, and Related Indexes, 1850-1880, NARA RG, Microfilm Series T655, Roll 15, Shelby County, Kentucky, 1870, (Accessed via ancestry.com).
